channel.title: Network on D0CUM3NTN4T10N
channel.description: Recent content in Network on D0CUM3NTN4T10N

item.title: OSINT (Open Source Intelligence)
item.description: Automation linkOSINT is a powerful method for investigating target organizations, websites, etc. However, it’s the tedious task to surfin the internet for finding desired information one by one. For that reason, it’s also recommended to use automation tools. *It might overlap a bit with recon automation tools BBOT A powerful subdomain scanner and port mapper. Blackbird Searches accounts by username in social networks. Maltego A comprehensive tool for information gathering.

item.title: Port Scan
item.description: Nmap linkNmap is still the most commonly used tool when scanning ports of the target system. But in recent years, some other tools, such as masscan or rustscan, are also becoming popular because the tools scan faster than nmap. Basic Scan linkIt’s recommened to do as stealth scan (SYN scan) by adding the option -sS. Also it’s prefered to add -T2 flag for being polite. sudo nmap -sS <target-ip> sudo nmap -sS <target-ip> -T2 # -V: OS version detection # -C: Default NSE sudo nmap -sSVC <target-ip> # -A: All detection sudo nmap -sS -A <target-ip> Skipping the host discovery

item.title: Linux Pivoting
item.description: Enumerate Network in Remote Machine linkAfter entering remote machine, we can enumerate and search other networks. Before that if the target machine does not have nmap, we can upload the binary to target machine. # Linux 64-bit wget https://github.com/andrew-d/static-binaries/raw/master/binaries/linux/x86_64/nmap When we’re ready, let’s investigate the network as follow. # ARP cache arp -a # Network hosts, ip addresses cat /etc/hosts cat /etc/resolv.conf nmcli dev show # Network ranges nmap 10.0.0.1-255 nmap 172.

item.title: Windows Pivoting
item.description: Enumerate Network linkAfter entering the target server, enumerate and search other networks. Check the ARP Cache in Target Machine link arp.exe -a Check IP Addresses link Get-Content c:\Windows\System32\drivers\etc\hosts ipconfig /all Search Other Network Ranges linkNo content yet.
